column4: Hi! How can I use my pendrive from ubuntu? /var/log/messages shows the new usb device, but after the usb-storage don't show the partitions.
Simple usb-stick. Should be recognized as sd device.
with what program du u try do access?
oCean: The kernel can not recognize it. /var/log/messages shows ehci messages, "new speed USB device,. ..".
ignoring that fact, just try to mount per console manualy
often, it return messages much more useful to u
oCean: Curious, that now it recognizes the pendrive..., Usually after bootup it doesn't work.
oCean: When it works, /var/log/messages seems the partitions, and nautilus opens the drive automatically. After bootup (when doesn't work) it knows the usb device, but not the partitions, etc.
oCean_: I hate it too. I don't know, why is this. Maybe uhci driver gets to work later. Is it required?
oCean_: I try a reboot, maybe I will have more data. It's really weird.. Thanx the help.
oCean_: Thanks the help! I do a reboot to test it.
oCean_: How can i add a usb storrage by hand in the /etc/modules?
Don't know, just edit it wit htexteditor :P
